Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-red pottery vessel, both the interior and exterior are covered with a burnished red-slip, with remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394573) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394573)
